captions.text: (Music)
Hey Eddheads, Tom here.
You might know me better like this.

So, first of all i'd like to thank you guys
so much for the overwhelming amount of love

and support you've been giving us for the
past not just two months but all the years

leading up to now. It made a huge difference
to Edd and it's made a huge difference to

me and all the other friends and family affected
by the recent events. In case you don't know

what i'm talking about here is a quick recap.
Around 15 years ago a little boy named Edd

Gould started drawing comics about his playground
friends and inspired by the movie Waynes World

decided to call it Eddsworld. Over time friends
changed and the style grew and eventually

Eddsworld became a terribly animated cartoon.
Then in 2006 Edd developed Leukaemia, cancer

of the blood. He fought hard and eventually
beat the cancer into remission. Yay! Then

with the help of his best friend Matt, aspiring
producer Tom and an army of friends, Eddsworld

grew and grew until it's audience reached
hundreds of thousands. However after 5 awesome

years Edds cancer came back and this time
it brought all of its friends. After a year
long battle the fight was over and Edd passed away.

Yeah, it's not awesome. But before Edd left
he made it very clear he didn't want the show

to end with him and we are happy to keep it
going, but personally I don't feel okay with

profiting directly off the success of the
show. I'd much rather all the money it makes

go into one of the great cancer charities
out there and that is why i'm coming to you

guys. I would like you to help us raise just
enough money to make the show and nothing

else. That way we can make something great
and we can give everything we make from that
to charity. So, that's why I present 'Eddsworld Legacy'.
Oh, that sure sounds cool.

Okay so how does this work? Well I would like
you guys to go over to our IndieGoGo and make

a donation to Eddsworld. For every level of
donation there is a greater reward. It's starts

out small with a mini documentary about the
behind-the-scenes of making the show made

just for you guys the ones donating and then
it gets better and better each time and you

get stuff like wristbands, signed artwork
and the higher donations you even get a chance

to be in the show and stuff. And for every
higher donation you do you get all the stuff

from the lower ones as well. So, it's pretty
cool. And y'know it's not like a store. You're
donating, but you also get rewards.

And I just want to point out that while the
site does list everything in dollars you can

donate to us from wherever you are in the
world and i'll include a pound to dollars
conversion rate reference on the website.

So, the next big question is why do we need
money to make the show? Well, believe it or

not this is actually our full time jobs and
it's how we make a living. It's how Edd made

a living as well and now that he's gone we
need to find someone who can do the kind of

work that he did. And it's not just animation
that goes into a show like this. There are
loads of people involved such as...

This fantastic Canadian fellow responsible
for the music.

This guy who makes everything actually sound
good when you listen to it.

This... Oh, I'm sorry I don't really know
what he's doing.
OH! I'M SO SORRY ABOUT HIM! I HAD NO IDE-
Okay.

And after seeing him in almost every single
eddisode and more recently after seeing some

of his actual work. I would like to introduce
you to the shows new lead animator Paul Ter Voorde.

And while I hate that this is the case, the
show is called Eddsworld and we can't really

have a show without Edd, but when he left
us he took his voice with him. So, we will

be replacing his voice with someone quite
close to the show.
MYSTERY!

And once again I would like to thank you guys
so much for the amount of love and support

you have given us. And hopefully you'll continue
your support to keep Eddsworld spinning. Thank you.
